english: to fall; to drop; to decline; to set (of sun)

etymology.interpretation: 艹 marks an association with plants or vegetation, hinting at senses like leaves or petals falling. 洛 supplies the pronunciation luò, and the meaning broadened from plant-related falling to general senses like drop, decline, or set (of the sun).

examples.chinese: 太阳落山了(太陽落山了)。
examples.english: The sun has set behind the hills.

examples.chinese: 雨点落在窗上(雨點落在窗上)。
